name: Michael Godfrey
bio: I'm a self-taught web developer who discovered my love for coding when I began building things on the web. I'm determined to master web development technologies and turn it into a profession.

milestones.title: First pull request merged on open-source project.
milestones.description: My first contribution to an open-source project. I forked the hacktoberfest-practice repo, added my own profile and made the pull request.

milestones.title: First server side project published online
milestones.description: I made an API and hosted it on Heroku (now on Firebase) to provide data for a cute phrase guessing game.

milestones.title: Completed #100DaysOfCode Challenge
milestones.description: I coded for a minimum of 1 hour a day for 100 consecutive days and shared my work on Twitter for accountability.

milestones.title: Completed TreeHouse TechDegree - Frontend Web Development
milestones.description: After several months of consistent work, I earned the TechDegree for frontend web development and had a foundation to build on.

milestones.title: Started TreeHouse TechDegree - Frontend Web Development
milestones.description: This is where it started. While I had dabbled in coding before, I signed up for the TechDegree because I DECIDED to get into tech.
